It was a long trip for the shuttle, and a realitvely quiet one. The steady =
drone of the engines pushing the craft through the air was pretty much the =
only sound that could be heard for most of the trip. 

Oh there was the occ=
asional sporatic conversation, but by and large everyone was thinking over =
what they knew of Cryonosis. 

As they neared the Antarctic the ride began =
to get a little more bumpy as the colder winds sent eddies and gusts their =
direction. However POLAR CLAW and PROWL in the front pilot seats seemed to =
have the whole thing under control. 

"There she is." POLAR CLAW said, brea=
king the silence in the cabin. A cabin viewscreen came online showing the s=
huttle passing over the many iceflows and coming onto the mainland itself. =


In the distance, was a stoutly built tower standing up like a spike, surr=
ounded on nearly all sides by white mountains built of ice and stone, surro=
nding the tower like a natually built wall. Inside this 'wall' was a large =
iced blue lake its wateres also stretching around the tower like a moat. 

=
The place looked isolated, cold and remote and yet strangely bueatiful all =
at the same time. 

"All right we are going in, stay frosty." POLAR CLAW sa=
id. "We still don't know what or who is here, but I am getting strange read=
ings. It's almost as if . . . "

Then the tower seemed to turn as weapon mo=
unts began to unfold. 

*THOOM*  *THOOM*  *THOOM*

"It looks as if someone =
is already here." PROWL said as the tower opened fire on the shuttle. The s=
huttle banked and turned and then bucked as it took a hit, and then another=
. 

(TAG)

Preston
